text: This has been rolled out to all of the share pages. We still have to run a full accessibility audit on these and will be working on rolling these out for embedded forms later in this year.
does anyone know of a good utility js library for accessibility?

Originally had this in general because i apparently can’t read to see there was an a11y channel:
accessibility question -  Is there any way to specify a background color AND background image in a section/row (not via inline css which isn’t possible in this case)?
If you specify an image as a background to a section or a row it doesn’t seem like you can specify a color which means if you have a site with a black background, and a section/row that you want a yellow image as the background, and then black text over that image, it’s flagged cuz it’s black on black if the image goes missing. In code a person would do background: #fff url(image-here.jpg); I can’t set a generic background color in CSS as this section is controlled by the user when they populate the content of the page so it could be yellow, or not.
